alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 6:27PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of northeastern Idaho, eastern Clearwater, southeastern Mineral, southern Missoula, northwestern Granite, northwestern Ravalli and west central Powell Counties through 815 PM MDT/715 PM PDT/... At 725 PM MDT/625 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from near Wye to 22 miles east of Lowell. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Roads may quickly become snow covered and slick. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Hamilton, Lolo, Stevensville, Darby, Florence, Victor, Woodside, Wye, Bonner-West Riverside, East Missoula, Frenchtown, Pinesdale, Potomac, Quigley, Corvallis, Lolo Pass, Turah, Como and Bell Crossing. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 86 and 134. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 6. Highway 93 S between mile markers 29 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
